title: Exhaust header Assembly Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
If removed, apply a thin smear of anti-seize compound to the threads of the oxygen sensor, install the oxygen sensor and tighten to
Position the header assembly under the motorcycle.
Raise the rear of the header assembly and align the rear mounting point.
Fit new seals to the cylinder head. Make sure that the face of the seal with the tab is facing the cylinder head.
A smear of grease may be used to retain the seals in the cylinder head during assembly.
Locate the exhaust header pipes and align the exhaust header pipe flanges to the fixing points. Fit new nuts and hand tighten.
Assemble the rear mounting point fixing but do not tighten at this stage.
Tighten the exhaust header pipe to cylinder head nuts in the sequence shown below:
Tighten the exhaust header pipe nuts to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe nuts to
Tighten the rear mounting point fixing to
Reconnect the oxygen sensor and route the harness under the sump guard as noted on disassembly.
Position and engage the silencer to the exhaust header pipe. Do not tighten the clamp at this stage.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to

Do not install the exhaust system or run the engine without the exhaust heat shields fitted. Components protected by the exhaust heat shields may suffer severe damage or a fire if the motorcycle is operated without the heat shields being fitted.
Start the engine and check for exhaust gas leaks. Rectify if necessary.
Exhaust Header Install (CG7; CM7; CN7; CR7; CT7, CX7; CR7)

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: CF7; CX7; CT7; CR7; CN7; CM7; CG7

search: Exhaust header Assembly Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
If removed, apply a thin smear of anti-seize compound to the threads of the oxygen sensor, install the oxygen sensor and tighten to
25 Nm
Position the header assembly under the motorcycle.
Raise the rear of the header assembly and align the rear mounting point.
Loosely install the rear fixing.
Fit new seals to the cylinder head. Make sure that the face of the seal with the tab is facing the cylinder head.
A smear of grease may be used to retain the seals in the cylinder head during assembly.
Cylinder head
Seal
Seal tab
Locate the exhaust header pipes and align the exhaust header pipe flanges to the fixing points. Fit new nuts and hand tighten.
Assemble the rear mounting point fixing but do not tighten at this stage.
Tighten the exhaust header pipe to cylinder head nuts in the sequence shown below:
Stage 1:
Tighten the exhaust header pipe nuts to
2 Nm
Stage 2:
Tighten the exhaust header pipe nuts to
19 Nm
Exhaust Header Pipe Tightening Sequence
Tighten the rear mounting point fixing to
19 Nm
Reconnect the oxygen sensor and route the harness under the sump guard as noted on disassembly.
Position and engage the silencer to the exhaust header pipe. Do not tighten the clamp at this stage.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to
4.5 Nm

Do not install the exhaust system or run the engine without the exhaust heat shields fitted. Components protected by the exhaust heat shields may suffer severe damage or a fire if the motorcycle is operated without the heat shields being fitted.
Start the engine and check for exhaust gas leaks. Rectify if necessary.
Perform the following operations:
Plastic Sump Guard - Installation
Silencer Installation
Battery - Terminal Connect
Rider's Seat - Removal/Installation
